summary:
Energetic, high achieving and organized ‘people person’ driven by connecting people and ideas, and solving human-centred problems. Skilled communicator, problem solver, group facilitator & critical thinker.

Core beliefs I bring to my work: 
• Humour and fun have a rightful place in the workplace, and only lead to a more productive culture. 
• Learning from your mistakes and unashamedly sharing these learnings is the best way for both you and your team to grow.
• The relationships we build with our colleagues and clients are key - invest in people!

Outside of work: plant lover, saxophonist, occasional painter and enthusiastic dinner party host.

profile_positions.description:
As lead, I'm responsible for the overall direction and execution of the KPMG Emerging Giants program in NL - a holistic role which covers everything from defining the proposition, marketing and events, to account management. 

About KPMG Emerging Giants:
https://indialogue.io/KPMGEmergingGiants

KPMG Emerging Giants supports fast-growing startups and scaleups in their growth and international expansion. Over the years, we've seen high-growth companies face similar challenges as they reach key milestones in their journey, such as expanding internationally or scaling up their team. Drawing on this experience, we help startups and scaleups to avoid common pitfalls that may hinder their growth and to identify opportunities to accelerate it. With our dedicated team of experts, we provide hands-on support when it comes to Tax, Finance, Operations & Risk. 

KPMG has been (and still is) a proud supporter of the Dutch startup ecosystem for years, supporting some of the most iconic Dutch companies like Adyen, Booking.com and Otrium on their journey towards becoming unicorns. In 2016, KPMG became a founding partner of tech-hub TNW Spaces together with Google, ABN AMRO and Booking.com. Since then, many more collaborations with leading incubators, accelerators, hubs and programs have followed, extending KPMG’s support for startups and scaleups throughout the ecosystem and the Netherlands.

Need support at your company? Get in touch and I'll be happy to see how we can help!
profile_positions.title: Lead | KPMG NL Emerging Giants (start/scale-up program)

profile_positions.description:
Mischief Makers is a facilitation agency focused on making meetings, workshops and events more effective and enjoyable. They can support you in shaping and hosting your next gathering as well as train you in confidently doing so yourself - leading groups online, offline and hybrid.

As a mischievous contributor, I am part of their global network of facilitators, ready to be brought on board for top notch workshops, programmes, trainings or specific client assignments.

profile_positions.description:
TNW is a global brand that informs, inspires, and connected the international tech community through media, events and spaces.

• Lead for TNW's Community Program & Partnerships
—> Defining, refining, and executing our offering, identifying new opportunities and onboarding partners
—> Manage relationships with all stakeholders including key (commercial & non-commerical) partners, from tech/corporate giants such as Google, KPMG, AWS, to local firms, to educational institutions and non-profits 
—> Oversee the conception, planning and execution of all partner programs and events at TNW spaces to bring the right expertise and connects to our community of tech startups and scaleups

• Senior project manager for strategic client projects
—> Specialising in strategic events 
—> Examples include Google for Startups EMEA Partner Summit (2-day conference), Nationale Nederlander Summer School (9-week long event series), Hangout with VCs (international startup-VC match making event) and more

• Core member of TNW2021 team (flagship conference), with focus on production of live partnership deliverables

• Member of the company-wide workgroup to improve company process & create greater synergy between departments
profile_positions.title: Community Partnerships Lead & Senior Strategic Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
• Responsible for shaping, curating and executing the TNW spaces program, designed to help the startup and tech community to connect and grow whilst fulfilling the objectives of our partners
• Manage relationships with our key existing partners - including Google, KPMG and ABN AMRO - and shape the programs that we do together to ensure engagement
• Manage the team responsible for the commercial rental of our event spaces and production of events in our spaces.
• Oversaw production of 295 events in 2019 alone, and hundreds more in my time at TNW
profile_positions.title: Head of Program & Events, TNW spaces

profile_positions.description:
TQ is a curated tech hub, founded by TNW (rebranded to TNW spaces in April 2020). We help push startups towards exponential growth via our community, facilities and program.

As program manager, I was responsible for:
• execution the TQ program - designed with the needs of our community in mind. For example, tech talks, workshops, job fair
• commercial event sales at our city centre venue - including managing bookings, handling all production details, welcoming clients, and doing all associated administration (invoicing etc). 
• the production of all programs and events - making sure our spaces were ready for all events, providing a top notch experience for our community and external clients

Event clients include Google, Adidas, Booking.com, Amazon, Facebook and more.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager, TNW spaces

company.name: The Cultural Cookery Restaurant Project, Utrecht, NL

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Cultural Cookery Restaurant is an annual charity event hosted by a group of six students from University College Utrecht (Netherlands) who form the Cultural Cookery Board. This project involved taking over and running a professional restaurant for two weeks, with all of the profit going to charity. Running the restaurant involved everything from designing the menu, buying and cooking the food to taking reservations and providing evening entertainment for our guests.

This project involved a great deal of organization, both before and during the event. Although the restaurant itself only ran for eight days over two weeks, it required months of organization before we could reach this moment. 

My official role in the team was Sponsorship Co-ordinator, making me responsible for finding and securing sponsors to maximise our profit which would go to charity. Our theme for the restaurant was "home-grown", so I targeted local farmers who supplied us with fresh produce, either for free or at a reduced rate.

However, this was by far the only role I took in the preparations for the restaurant. I took joint-lead in our search for a venue to host our project after our initial hosts dropped out only 5 weeks before the our opening night. Aside from this I also had an important role in promoting our project, and designing a professional menu that was both practical and attractive. 

During the event I played many roles: I was an assistant chef throughout the day; and in the evenings I worked in the restaurant, preparing and serving food.

Throughout this whole project, I also had the experience of doing all of this in another country. Although the Netherlands is famous for its fantastic English, the language barrier could still pose various problems as my Dutch language skills were still quite basic. This was an extra element which made the whole experience even more interesting!

company.name: Nambikki Illam, Faith Welfare Trust, Chennai, India

volunteer_experiences.description: Faith Welfare Trust is a charity which funds and runs two children's homes and a school in Chennai, India. I have been to Nambikkai Illam three times so far, and intend to go back soon. When at the children's home I spent my time interacting and entertaining the children when they are not at school. This is challenging due to the language barrier,  however I do not object to being outside of my comfort zone as I can adapt well to challenging situations. I took a position of responsibility in organising the activities for the children to do (around 60 children in total). This was challenging but from this experience my leadership and communication skills have developed.

I was part of the promotion team and fundraising team for this charity festival. Prior to the event, I was involved in various campaigns to advertise the event, using the skills of promotion and communication that I have learned from previous work experience, such as working as a Student Ambassador. On the day of the Festival, I spent time helping the smooth running of the day and raising money. Through these activities I was able to contribute to an event which raised £4215 for Oxfam.

company.name: World Association of Girl Guides and Girl Scouts

volunteer_experiences.description: For three years I volunteered as a Young Leader at Brownies (Girl Guiding for 7-9 year olds). I was responsible for supervising and organising activities on a weekly basis, and providing a support network for the girls. This required good leadership skills and confidence - children can sometimes be difficult to work with! With these skills I was able to create a relationship with the girls which combined authority and friendship as my role was to ensure they had fun, but also take responsibility.

Leeds Actions is a university organisation that coordinates many different charity programs and volunteering opportunities. I volunteered with the Bridge the Gap program which involves visiting old people’s homes to talk and play bingo. I enjoyed this project as it allowed me to interact with people who I would not normally cross paths with.

company.name: Salaam Balak Trust, New Delhi, India

volunteer_experiences.description: The Salaam Balak Trust is an organisation for the care of street children. I volunteered with this charity in 2009, working with the children in the centre in New Delhi. I was involved in organising and running games with the children, which were both fun and educational. This was challenging due to the language barrier, and it was also my first time volunteering in India.

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer for the Great Daffodil Appeal
Event Planner for Strawberry Tea Party Fundraiser
volunteer_experiences.description: Whilst I was at school, two friends and I organised a Strawberry Tea Party to raise money for Breast Cancer Care. I was involved in gaining sponsorship, promoting the event, organising and setting up the venue, making food, and being flexible on the day to make sure everything ran smoothly. Everything went to plan, and we were able to raise over £2,200 in one morning!
